t: Blessedness of Forgiveness and of Trust in God.
A Psalm of David. A Maskil.
How*pn blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, Whose*ln sin is covered!
How*ln blessed is the man to whom the Lord*s does not impute iniquity, And*ln in whose spirit there is no deceit!
When*ln I kept silent about*i my*i sin,*i my body wasted away Through*ln my groaning all day long.
For*ln day and night Your hand was heavy upon me; My*ln vitality was drained away as*i with the fever heat of summer. Selah.
I*ln acknowledged my sin to You, And*ln my iniquity I did not hide; I*ln said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord”;*s And*ln You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah.
Therefore,*ln let everyone who is godly pray to You in a time when You may be found; Surely*ln in a flood of great waters they will not reach him.
You*ln are my hiding place; You preserve me from trouble; You*ln surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah.
I*ln will instruct you and teach you in the way which you should go; I*ln will counsel you with My eye upon you.
Do*ln not be as the horse or as the mule which have no understanding, Whose*ln trappings include bit and bridle to hold them in check, Otherwise*iln they will not come near to you.
Many*ln are the sorrows of the wicked, But*ln he who trusts in the Lord,*s lovingkindness shall surround him.
Be*ln glad in the Lord*s and rejoice, you righteous ones; And*ln shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart.
